text: Mufti (/ˈmʌfti/; Arabic: مفتي), an Islamic legal authority who gives a formal legal opinion (fatwa) in answer to an inquiry by a private individual or judge. A fatwa usually requires knowledge of the Qur'ān and Hadith (narratives concerning the Prophet’s life and sayings), as well as knowledge of exegesis and collected precedents, and might be a pronouncement on some problematic legal matter. == Other websites == * Fatwa – multi-part article from The Oxford Encyclopedia of the Islamic World, via Oxford Islamic Studies * The ethics of Muftī by Imam Ibn Khaldûn * * Category:Arabic words and phrases Category:Islamic religious leaders Category:Lawyers
title: Mufti
